    ZestFinance Overview

    www.zestfinance.com
    Los Angeles, CA
    51 to 200 employees
    2009
    Company - Private
    Financial Analytics & Research
    $50 to $100 million (USD) per year
    ZestFinance, Inc. applies its unique credit-decisioning technology platform — based on data science and machine learning — to help lenders effectively predict credit risk so they can increase revenues, reduce risk and ensure compliance. ZestFinance was ... Read more

    Mission: Our mission is to make fair and transparent credit available to everyone. We're doing that by working with the world’s most innovative banks and lenders to re-invent how they give credit to millions of consumers and businesses.

    ZestFinance – Why Work For Us?

    • What We Do
    • Why ZestFinance
    • Who We Are

    Our Story

    We're working with the world’s most innovative banks and lenders to re-invent how they give credit to millions of consumers and businesses. Old-world scoring techniques fail to take advantage of today’s data-rich environment. AI and machine learning can make better underwriting decisions using more of the data already there. That’s where you come in.

    Founded by Douglas Merrill, the former CIO of Google, we built the ZAML Platform to apply Google-like math to credit decisions.

    ZAML is able to consume vast amounts of data to more accurately identify good borrowers — enabling higher repayment rates for lenders and lower-cost credit for consumers.

    While many creditors take hours, or even days, to make credit decisions, ZAML helps clients make them — accurately — in less than 10 seconds.

    ZAML® is the only machine learning credit and risk modeling solution with end-to-end explainability. It's fast, powerful, and compliant.

    Read more

    Our Mission

    Our mission is to make fair and transparent credit available to everyone. We're doing that by working with the world’s most innovative banks and lenders to re-invent how they give credit to millions of consumers and businesses.

    Amazing Benefits
    Including healthcare, retirement and unlimited vacation time. Not to mention an onsite gym and cell phone reimbursement.
    Free Lunch
    We bring in healthy, delicious lunches every day from some of LA’s best restaurants.
    Interesting Projects
    We are working on technically difficult math and complex computer science. You’ll always be
    challenged to think creatively to solve tough problems.
    Location, location, location!
    Based in sunny Los Angeles, where the temperature is a variation on perfect most days of the year.
     Fun
    We don’t take ourselves too seriously and believe having fun goes hand in hand with thinking hard. Video games, ping pong, gigantic jigsaw puzzles and game nights are regular activities around here.
    Culture
    Zestians share a desire to change the world, be on the customer’s side, and voice our thoughts openly so that the best ideas win. We accept big challenges and relish the chance to learn along the way.
    Read more

    Douglas Merrill

    Founder & CEO

    I started my career with a Ph.D. from Princeton and have done lots of different things since then. I worked as a researcher at the RAND Corporation, a security consultant at PricewaterhouseCoopers, and Senior VP at Charles Schwab. I joined Google in 2003, and spent 5 (great!) years there as their CIO and VP of Engineering. I’m a technologist and data junkie at heart, but also love motorcycles, tattoos, and ’80s music. I care deeply about people and animals and support a variety of charities related to drug rehabilitation and animal rescue.

    Mike de Vere

    Chief Operating Officer 

    I find joy in transforming organizations large and small, public and private, and love nothing better than figuring out how to use technology to solve strategic business issues. Whether reimagining Nielsen’s global insights business as a SaaS-based model or identifying new avenues to monetize the Harris Poll web traffic, I continually lean on my ability to craft a vision and motivate teams to execute. As the chief operating officer for a financial services start-up and in various roles over a decade at JD Power, I found success usually comes from looking at situations through the lens of the customer. I’m a Southern California native all the way (MBA from the University of Southern California) and thrilled to play a role at one of the great local startups on a mission to do some good for the average person.

    Sonya Boralv Merrill

    People Operations

    I’ve been in technology since its dot-com heyday, at startups and huge companies alike. I spent more than 4 amazing years running product and international communications for Google and was ecstatic when the opportunity to help found ZestFinance came along. It’s an amazing feeling to go to work every day and know that you are simultaneously changing the game for average Americans and the technology sector at large. At Zest, my primary focus has always been to build a corporate culture where people can grow and thrive — both at work and where it matters most — in their personal lives. Zest rocks and the people here are incredible. What more can I say?

    Jay Budzik

    Technology

    I find great satisfaction in inventing new technologies, particularly in data mining and AI. While earning my Ph.D. in CS at Northwestern, I founded a company that brought AI-based search to enterprises. In my career, I’ve helped major media organizations apply AI & machine learning to expand their audiences and grow revenues, and developed systems that process tens of trillions of data points. I’m one of those people who thinks data is cool and that more data is always better, so Zest has been the perfect home for a guy like me.

    Kareem Saleh

    Executive Vice President 

    I've spent my career working at the intersection of finance, technology, and government. I cut my teeth as the consigliere to business leaders and senior officials in the Obama administration working on finance and green energy issues. I came away from that work convinced that machine learning could ignite a credit revolution around the world and serve as an important driver of financial inclusion and poverty alleviation. Now I help the world's most prestigious financial institutions expand access to credit by transitioning from conventional underwriting techniques to artificial intelligence-based ones. At Zest I'm fortunate to work across a variety of functions including sales, marketing, legal, and government affairs.


    Read more

      "A Tech Gem in Burbank"

      StarStarStarStarStar
      • Work/Life Balance

      • Senior Management
      Current Employee - Anonymous Employee
      Current Employee - Anonymous Employee
      Recommends
      Positive Outlook
      Approves of CEO

      I have been working at ZestFinance full-time (More than a year)

      Pros

      I was impressed with the company from the moment of my interview - super bottomed-up process that ensures only smart, driven and collaborative people are hired. As a result the culture here is upbeat and energetic. The business is poised for amazing growth. The company continues to hire top talent and great leaders to build momentum and best practices. I have a lot of autonomy and satisfaction in my job. Benefits …  are over the top.Show More

      Cons

      The company has developed some amazing products but it is also experiencing some expected growing pain which requires our collective focus to build out better processes and improve efficiency.

      Advice to Management

      Focus relentlessly on efficiency and margin which will take us to new heights

      ZestFinance 2019-08-06 20:05 PDT

    Interviewing at ZestFinance

    1. Featured Interview

       

      Sales Director Interview

      Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
      Accepted Offer
      Positive Experience
      Difficult Interview

      Application

      I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at ZestFinance (Los Angeles, CA) in July 2018.

      Interview

      The interview process in a word is intense. There is a single final in-person interview which takes up most of the day. The process is very structured. There is a presentation (called homework) that the company takes very seriously inviting senior executives and potentially the CEO.

      Do not think that getting an on-site final interview means that you are most likely getting an offer. Zest is looking for the best people…  to join the company and will have many final interviews for each candidate hired.

      The work environment is casual and wearing a suit or even sports jacket is not required (they do not care how you dress). What is important is your intelligence, domain knowledge, ability to work in a fast paced start up environment and cultural fit.      Show More

      Interview Questions

      • Review common Google interview questions   Answer Question
      ZestFinance 2018-10-17 09:51 PDT
